get(input_data, port_number)[source]

The function that gets the entire input configuration for the data and returns the selected data-frame. param input_data: list of dictionary for input configuration. param port_number: the port number from where the data has to be fetched. return: spark data-frame

maxairesources.utilities.preprocessing module

class maxairesources.utilities.preprocessing.Preprocessing[source]

Bases: object

aggregate_transactional_data(dataframe, groupby_col, arguments)[source]

Converting transaction to cross sectional data

Parameters

  • dataframe – transactional dataframe to apply the pre-processing function

  • groupby_col – the column on which groupby is done before finding aggregation

  • arguments – list of dictionaries containing event column, filter items, aggregation column, operation and time period.

Returns

dataframe after pre-processing

Return type

preprocessed_df

Examples

Inputs:

dataframe: df groupby_col: “customer_id” arguments = [{“event_column”:”product”, “agg_col”:”revenue”, “filter”: “all”,

“operation”: 2, “time_period”: 60},

{“event_column”:”product”, “agg_col”:”revenue”, “filter”: “all”,

“operation”: 1, “time_period”: 30}]

Output:

preprocessed_df: preprocessed dataframe with appropriate names

maxairesources.utilities.spark_distributor module

class maxairesources.utilities.spark_distributor.SparkDistributor(python_function, spark_dataframe, *args, sample_size: int = 100, output_schema=None, group_key: Optional[str] = None, parallelism: Optional[int] = None, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: object

A Pyspark wrapper module to distribute python functions which are mainly written using Pandas.

Parameters

  • python_function (function) – A user defined function that should take Pandas Dataframe as input and return Pandas Dataframe as output

  • spark_dataframe (spark dataframe) – The Dataframe which needs to be processed using the python function

  • args – Arguments to Python function

  • sample_size (int) – The number of sample records to be used to call the python function directly. The call to python function using sample of a pandas dataframe is used to infer the schema for the Final Dataframe. Increase the sample size if the python function is not able to execute with the given sample size

  • output_schema – schema of the output dataframe. If None the function tries to infer the schema by using sample of data. The size of the sample is specified by sample size

  • group_key – Name of the column to do grouby on. If None then spark partition id is used as a group_key

  • parallelism – Specifies the number of partitions. If none then no repartition is performed

  • kwargs – Keyword Arguments to Python Function

Example:

import SparkDistributor

spark_wrapper = SparkDistributor(python_function,spark_df) result = spark_wrapper.pandas_to_spark_wrapper() result.show()

pandas_to_spark_wrapper()[source]

maxairesources.utilities.train_test_split module

class maxairesources.utilities.train_test_split.TrainTestSplit(data, train_size, params={'random_state': True, 'stratify': None, 'ts': False}, seed=123)[source]

Bases: object

A Pyspark wrapper module to do a Train Test split.

Parameters

  • data (spark_dataframe) – spark dataframe to be passed on which train_test_split needs to happend

  • train_size (float) – train_size to be passed in ratio

  • params (dictionary) – Three options are supported in params and should be passed as true 1. random_state - to do a random split 2. stratify - to do a stratified split 3. ts - to do a time series split

  • seed (int) – pass same seed for reproducibility

Example:

import train_test_split ``` split = TrainTestSplit(data = spark_df,

train_size = 0.8, params = {“random_state”:True}, seed = 123)

train,test = split.train_test_split() train.show() ```

random_split(df, fraction)[source]
stratified_split(df, frac, label, seed, join_on)[source]
time_series_split(df, frac)[source]
